TopicTitle: ONLINE SAVE SYSTEM. (cloud, steam or account)

Articles.Content:
My parents are basicly not living with each other anymore (divorce), so I have to stay with 1 for one week and the other the next week and so on.

I have 2 gaming computers and I like to play KSP on both of them... HOWEVER... KSP does not support an form of Migrating save system, and its sad when you play only with stock parts and cannot continue the same progress on the other computer when you have to leave or play at a friends house and wanna show of the builds and progress.

My point is... Could KSP get an save system? Atleast an option for it. Or atleast would you guys look into it?
Put all of your saves and mods into Dropbox, then symlink the files into the game structure on both computers. This method works brilliantly and even allows for turn based multiplayer.

I'm going to agree with Rich here. There's no need to reinvent the wheel for every game; save files can easily be switched out and in, and there are plenty of ways to share files in existence already.
